intro: [WRONG START] Orobus ledeburii, commonly known as the Cape yellow daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark brown disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Orobus ledeburii is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
